title: Representations - Behavior of f from f prime

content.question: Let <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be the function with derivative defined by <math alttext="f prime of x, equals, 2 plus, open parenthesis, 2 x minus 8, close parenthesis, times the sine of, open parenthesis, x plus 3, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>8</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. How many points of inflection does the graph of <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> have on the interval <math alttext="0 is less than x, is less than 9" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo><</mo><mi>x</mi><mo><</mo><mn>9</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

topic.text: 5.8: Sketching Graphs of Functions and Their Derivatives

skill.text: Skill 2.D: Identify how mathematical characteristics or properties of functions are related in different representations.
